list_definition.definition: a tropical fruit, a brown pod with a juicy, spicy pulp used in medicines, drinks etc

list_ex_of_english: Important cash crops include mangos, sapotes, tamarind, hibiscus, amaranth, spearmint, tomatoes and potatoes.
The first flavors were apricot, apple, guava, mango, pear, plum and tamarind, today several additional flavors and blends are offered under its brands.
Ingredients vary among vendors with some also using "hae ko" prawn/shrimp paste, tamarind or black bean paste in the mix.
The fruit are often pickled and used as a substitute for tamarind or made into sweetmeat.
Dal may be cooked with onion, garlic, ginger, chili, tomatoes, or tamarind, in addition to lentils or beans.
Its industries include the processing of timber, rubber, and palm oil, as well as furniture, tamarind balm and footwear manufacturing.
Along with tamarind, sugar and spices are added to (regional) taste for chutneys or a multitude of condiments for a bitter-sweet flavor.
Generous use of chili powder and tamarind make the dishes tangy and hot.
